question: What method do you have to define to create a constructor for a class?
choice_a: a method with the same name as the class

question: When an @function_name appears before a function definition, what is it called?
What method do you have to define so that you can specify what gets printed out when you pass an instance of your class to print?
What does the @staticmethod decorator allow?
choice_a: allows a method to be called from the class only
choice_b: allows a method to be called from an instance only
choice_c: allows a method to be called from both an instance and the class
choice_d: prevents a method from being called from both an instance and a class
